subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01BA_01C9D937.BB8230B0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Aww thanks Eric!  And your welcome.


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  Fro=
m: Eric VanDuzer 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 20,=
 2009 10:40 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.





  Nice =
explanation I like it probably the best I have heard thank you




  On Wed=
, May 20, 2009 at 12:35 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghostresear=
ch.com> wrote:





    2 different things happening-that's why. When you g=
et EVP that everyone understands, it is outward, in the environment. Not a =
communication through subconscious means.

    EVP that people swear they h=
ear, but noone else can make sense, may be a message to them via subconscio=
us means. That isn't to say that ALL EVP's like this are true messages, I a=
m sure alot are just matrixing.

    But then that is how the art of scryin=
g starts-matrixing. Like the Rorschach tests. The images you matrix with th=
ose gives the psychologist an insight into your mind.

    By gazing into a=
 dark, reflective surface, you start to see cloudy images. At first, you wi=
ll just be matrixing faces in the clouds and not getting much substance. Tr=
y it, you will see what I am saying. With practice, you start to see clear,=
 concise images.

    I think that is what happening with audio as well.

 =
   We already know for a fact pareidolia can occur in audio as well as visu=
al stimulus.

      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: Eric VanDuzer=
 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10=
:19 AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


      yes I un=
derstand its personal to that particular individual but why can't I hear it=
.  I have gotten some very personal EVPs through the traditional investigat=
ion way (not through a box or anything of that matter) that all others have=
 heard.



      On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 12:15 PM, April Abercrombie <april=
@...> wrote:





        "If one person is not me=
ant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to believe =
that one right yet)." 

        I don't know for sure about that one either=
, but I am not ready to discount it either, especially since I stumbled acr=
oss the possibility of audible scrying. But I am sure alot of people don't =
believe in scrying at all either.

        What makes it a possibility to m=
e is that so many people are hearing things that are very personal, but stu=
ff they would not have come up with on their own.


          ----- Origina=
l Message ----- 
          From: Eric VanDuzer 
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups.com 
          Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:09 AM
          Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.


          I think that is the p=
roblem I am having though Jim.  When you say "work them over till you hear =
them"  to me I should not have to work them over till I hear them.  Yes tak=
ing out the ambient and background noise is one thing.  But if you just kee=
p on listening to them with different enhancements you are bound to hear so=
mething (matrixing).  If one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear=
 it (I guess I am not quite ready to believe that one right yet).  I think =
you all know what I am getting at.  



          On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 9=
:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@...> wrote:




            Well=
, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much because I really don't know =
HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been at it for a couple weeks. BU=
T if you can clean up something to where you can FIND what was there to beg=
in with "you have done no harm" I hear alot more than others I guess, and I=
 haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone is able to clean them up...I =
DO promise you will hear what I say is correct)Pretty BOLD statement, but i=
f you are able to clean it up with better software (please do for others to=
o) I will be more than happy to "listen" where I made a mistake...I can onl=
y LEARN from it :) I have done some DEEP enhancements to a few of my evp's.=
..from the begining I could only hear clicks and thumps.....but after messi=
ng with that area, eventually I would hear the true voices (and can tell if=
 male or female...approximate age) and understand the mood also....these wh=
ere extreamly modified, and I feel that I could NOT have added enough "simp=
le" enhancements that would ADD a voice....full of emotion and distinct syl=
lables :) And some just can't hear them for what ever reason be it equipmen=
t that is used to hear (pc-headphones-speakers-ears) know one has the perfe=
ct match of all these things. Check out "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files =
section....work them over till you hear them. I really can't do much more :=
)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@...> wrote:
     =
       >
            > Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way of do=
ing things. I do clean
            > up evps if I hear something and can't =
make it out do to ambient noise. So
            > hear is my question. When=
 do you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
            > enhancing "taint" =
the results? To me the more enhancing you do the less
            > convinc=
ing it becomes. I hope noone finds this offensive, it is not meant
        =
    > to be I am just really curious. The way I look at it is that if you h=
ave to
            > do so much enhancing to find anything, was there reall=
y something there to
            > begin with. Are we just making ourselves=
 believe there is something there??
            > 
            > Eric
     =
       >
